intro: Deppea oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca deppea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
